signalproc.input

Class ImportBinary

  • java.lang.Object
    • signalproc.input.ImportBinary

  • public class ImportBinary
extends java.lang.Object
    An utility class for importing binary data input streams

      • isOneBytePerColumn

        public boolean isOneBytePerColumn()
        Returns:
        true is the number of bytes for each column field is the same as the number for the data type (false if it is one byte per column)

      • setOneBytePerColumn

        public void setOneBytePerColumn(boolean state)
        Sets whether each column is one byte (or alternatively whether the number of bytes in a field is the same as the data type

      • readColumns

        public VectorType[] readColumns(DataSchema colschema,
                       DataSchema rowschema)
                         throws java.io.IOException
        Parameters:
        colschema - the columns that are to be read in (e.g. 2,3,6-10)
        rowschema - the rows that are to be included in the column (e.g. 2,3,8-10,15+)
        Returns:
        an array of columns read from the input stream according to the given schema (returns null if the end of input stream is reached)
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • readColumnData

        protected boolean readColumnData(DataSchema rowschema)
                          throws java.io.IOException
        Reads in a data set when importing columns.
        Returns:
        true if the data set has been fully read
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • readRow

        public VectorType readRow(DataSchema colschema,
                 DataSchema rowschema)
                   throws java.io.IOException
        Parameters:
        colschema - the columns that are to be included in the row (e.g. 2,3,6-10,15+)
        rowschema - the rows that are to be read in (e.g. 2,3,8-10,15+)
        Returns:
        a single row read from the input stream according to the given schemas (returns null if the end of input stream/end of data set is reached)
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • readRowData

        protected boolean readRowData(DataSchema rowschema)
                       throws java.io.IOException
        Reads in a data set when importing rows (only if at the start of the set)
        Returns:
        true if the data set was fully read
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • readAdditionalRow

        protected boolean readAdditionalRow()
                             throws java.io.IOException
        Reads in an additional row when the number of rows is unspecified
        Returns:
        true if the additional row was fully read
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
